byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Athens, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt. James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.
byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and JACK EWING

abstract: International Monetary Fund concedes that Greece needs debt relief for lasting economic recovery, but argues that government of Prime Min Alexis Tspiras for making country's economic crisis dramatically worse; concession is significant indication that Greece might win some relief if and when negotiations for a bailout resume.
lead_paragraph: The fund conceded an argument long made by Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras, even as it blamed the current government for making matters worse.

headline.main: I.M.F. Agrees With Athens That Greece Needs Debt Relief
headline.print_headline: Blaming Athens, I.M.F. Agrees Greek Economy Needs Debt Relief

snippet: The fund conceded an argument long made by Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras, even as it blamed the current government for making matters worse.
